Header.description: Content-Types that are acceptable for the response
The CSRF that has been received in system/get-x-csrf Api

title: Account activation
name: AccountActivation
description: This Api will be used to activate user account after registration via email activation code

Parameter.description: This attribute should define the unique email address, that has not been registered before in this system.
This is a 5 digit randomly generated code.

Error 4xx.description: This will define the type of error

examples.title: Invalid Token Exception:
examples.content:
Error 401: Unauthorized

Date: Wed, 16 Nov 2016 09:33:07 GMT
Server: Apache/2.4.23 (Ubuntu)
Cache-Control: no-cache
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
Vary: Accept-Encoding
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Length: 228
Connection: close
Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
X-RateLimit-Limit: 60
X-RateLimit-Remaining: 59
{
    "error": {
         "type": "TokenMismatchException",
         "message": "Invalid token has been provided"
    }
}

 Content-Encoding: gzip

 X-RateLimit-Remaining: 59

{

    "rule": "max",
    "rule_attributes": [
      "254"
    ]
  }
}

Header.description: Content-Types that are acceptable for the response

title: Get X-CSRF token
name: GetXcSRF
description:
This Api will be use to get X-CSRF token Most important, and should call on start up of application. I.e. this will be the first Api, application should call on background. CSRF protection applies to all unsafe HTTP requests (POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH). Received token from this API will be added in next all api request (unsafe HTTP requests) header along with the same key name, as received in this Api (X-CSRF-TOKEN).
This token expires after one hour of issue time, so please make sure to re-generate new token if local token is older then one hour. X-CSRF is a temporary token, and can expire in case of following change detected, to help prevent miss-use of this token..
1: IP address change.
2: Device change.

Success 200.description: System generated CSRF token, this token will use in users/register call

examples.title: Success:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK

Date: Wed, 16 Nov 2016 09:33:07 GMT
Server: Apache/2.4.23 (Ubuntu)
Cache-Control: no-cache
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
Set-Cookie: nap_app_secure_info=073bd41729; Max-Age=7200; Expires=Wed, 16-Nov-2016 11:33:07 GMT; Path=/; HttpOnly
Vary: Accept-Encoding
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Length: 228
Connection: close
Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8
X-RateLimit-Limit: 60
X-RateLimit-Remaining: 59

{
    "success": {
         "type": "ResponseReceived",
         "X-CSRF-TOKEN": "RPB9I23GABY0936FAFF"
    }
}

Header.description: Content-Types that are acceptable for the response
The CSRF that has been received in system/get-x-csrf Api

title: Login with Social Applications
name: LoginViaSocialApp
description: This Api will help users to merge their social accounts (permanent identity) with applications account. In this way, users will be able to synchronize their account application details, such as level, score, total reading details etc. with our cloud system. There are two types of token, that can be pass to this Api. Only one of them is required. If guest user login with Social APP, its guest account will be connected to social account.

Parameter.description: Facebook access token, received after facebook user login, token should have permission access from user against his email, date of birth and gender
Google plus access token, received after g-plus user login, token should have permission access from user against his email, date of birth and gender

Error 4xx.description: This will define the invalid token exception
This exception will come in case of invalid token

title: Register via Email
name: RegisterViaEmailsssss
description: This Api will be used to register users via email on system.

Parameter.description: This attribute should define Full name of user, who is trying to create account on system.
This attribute should define the unique email address, that has not been registered before in this system.
This attribute should define plain text password, on application side there should be no encryption.
This attribute should define application UUID.
This attribute should define user current timezone. For example: GMT+3

Error 4xx.description: This will define the type of error

Header.description: Content-Types that are acceptable for the response
The CSRF that has been received in system/get-x-csrf Api
Authorization header will hold the system generated token, that was generated in users/register Api call. e.g. Authorization: Bearer y04Njk3LTA0MjYzIi

title: BMI
name: SaveBmiValues
description: This Api will help to update user stats with height, weight, age which we later can use to calculate BMI.

Parameter.description: This attribute should define the unique email address.
This will define the height of the user
This will define the weight of the user
This will define the user's age

title: Update User Profile
name: UpdateUserProfile
description: This Api will help to update user profile with phone-no and latitude and longitude alongwith user stats to calculate estimated due date e.g: first-day-last-period, cycle-length OR conceive-date.

Parameter.description: This will latitude of the user's location
This will define the longitude of the user's location
Users phone number

This flag value define if we have the conceive date or not if due_date_calc_flag = 1, then we will also need first_day_last_period and cycle_length OR if due_date_calc_flag = 2, then we will require conceive_date
this date will define the first day of the last period
this will define the total time of the last periods
this is the conceive date value

Error 4xx.description: This will define the type of error

         "type": "AppointmentBooked",
         "message": "Appointment data saved",
         "appointment_time": "2018-09-02 16:10:00"
    }
}

Header.description: Content-Types that are acceptable for the response
The CSRF that has been received in system/get-x-csrf Api
Authorization header will hold the system generated token, that was generated in users/register Api call. e.g. Authorization: Bearer y04Njk3LTA0MjYzIi
